tweets.text:
Good to hear Suzanne Ward on @BBCRadioStoke talking about @EnvAgencyMids #airquality monitoring near Walleys Quarry.

Our 2 units will be in #odour report hotspots & meet monitoring best practice:
- Hamptons Housing Estate site is now liveüëá
- Silverdale Road site will start asap https://t.co/SGdkEn7Loh

We have started surveying on the River Eau in #Lincolnshire between Susworth & Scotton, to assess underwater features such as silt deposits. This will see if any targeted maintenance works are needed to help improve channel capacity & flow #floodaware https://t.co/jfAYnkCEJh

Good lord.The landfill gas is eye watering in the Westlands,seeped into the house gassing my 3 year old in his bed as we speak& I‚Äôm inhaling it in my living room(doors&windows closed).Sore throat with prickling sensation,asthmatic chest tightening @PHE_EoEngland @EnvAgency

This is what we need in Newcastle @EnvAgency @ClareDinnisEA @SimonTagg @AaronBell4NUL @NewsNBC @BorisJohnson @MPGeorgeEustice Something positive to come from this toxic situation, the town needs a huge turnaround to survive this @StinkStopthe https://t.co/emJvoLMbsq

tweets.text: So, now we all agree that there is a stink (a.k.a. H2S gas at sufficient levels to breach WHO health guidelines!), what are the chances of actually doing something about it? Gassed in my home again! @EnvAgencyMids @AaronBell4NUL @NewsNBC @StinkStopthe @WHO @bbcmtd  #StopTheStink

Great to see a number of wide buffer strips created alongside hedge restoration and leaky dams on this farm above Keswick as part of the Glenderamackin NFM project. Thanks to the contractor, tenant farmer, @NTNorthLakes, #WEG, @EnvAgencyNW. https://t.co/sO09vLSfsJ

¬£60 I have just paid to have ‚Äòfresh air‚Äô IN MY OWN HOME. Something needs to be done, and it needs to be done NOW! #stopthestink @AaronBell4NUL @StinkStopthe @SimonTagg @NewsNBC @RedIndustries2 @EnvAgency @WHO https://t.co/zCewzXoAOU
@SimonTagg @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL Why don‚Äôt you and the MP actually go and meet face to face with the Environment Agency at their offices?

@tayz_BETH We are covering our faces with Vick to try & mask smell, think shares in Vick going to rocket, no one would choose to live on landfill lane the Hamptons, I'd love new build home but not there, hope Keele students don't fall into trap of buying.

All these houses being built on a chalk aquifer. Is this sustainable?The run off will be immense too @mhclg @RobertJenrick @AquiferChalk @Feargal_Sharkey @NaturalEngland @TonyJuniper @EnvAgency @KentishStourCP @OurWestgate @UN_Water @UKSustain @SoilAssociation @Water https://t.co/KfJodg7tDE

urls.title: EA allows water firms to reduce sewage discharge monitoring
urls.description: Water and sewerage companies will be able to reduce the frequency with which they monitor the sewage they discharge into water bodies, after the Environment Agency (EA) relaxed its permitting requirements because of Covid-19.
